title: 107_hr3332
content: Attorney Fee Payment System Improvement Act of 2001 - Amends title II (OASDI) of the Social Security Act (SSA) to: (1) increase from $4,000 to $5,200 the maximum allowable attorney fee. And (2) cap the amount of attorney assessments at $100. Amends SSA title XVI to prescribe a fee payment system for attorneys representing individuals filing claims for past-due benefits in the SSI program. Caps attorney fees at 25 percent of such past-due benefits. Requires the Commissioner of Social Security to assess such an attorney up to $100.
